pageContext.claim: “[What happened with the FBI] was spying on my campaign, something that has never been done in the history of our country. This was an overthrow attempt at the presidency.”
pageContext.analysis: The FBI’s investigation into Russian interference with the 2016 campaign and possible connections between Russia and the Trump campaign were not an “overthrow attempt at the presidency.” Special counsel Robert Mueller revealed significant criminal activity by some of Trump's campaign advisers and by Russian individuals and entities. Mueller concluded Russian government actors successfully hacked into computers and obtained emails from persons associated with the Clinton campaign and Democratic Party organizations, and then publicly disseminated those materials through various intermediaries, including WikiLeaks, to sow discord in the United States, hurt Clinton and help Trump.
